features.build_features¶

Functions

convert_to_timestamp(df, time_columns) Coverts columns in a dataframe to datetime.
find_duplicates(df) Finds the names of duplicate columns.
find_empty_columns(df[, threshold]) A list of columns that have more > 80% missing values.
find_low_var_categories(data[, threshold]) Finds categorical columns with low variance.

features.build_features.find_duplicates(df)[source]¶

Finds the names of duplicate columns.

Finds the different data types in a dataframe. Creates a dictionary file with different data types as keys and the pertinent columns as keys.

Parameters:df (data : pandas.DataFrame) – dataframe to search for duplicates
Returns:duplicates – list of duplicate column names.
Return type:list
features.build_features.find_empty_columns(df, threshold=0.8)[source]¶

A list of columns that have more > 80% missing values.

For each column computes the number of missing values. If the value is greater than 80%, relative to column length, then column name is added to list.

Parameters:
  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – dataframe with columns to search
  • threshold (int (optional)) – threshold for deleting columns
Returns:

empty_columns – a list of columns with mostly empty values.
Return type:

list
features.build_features.find_low_variance(data, threshold=0.18)[source]¶

Finds columns with low variance.

Takes a dataframe as input. Creates a list of columns with low threshold. These columns can then be dropped from original dataframe.

Parameters:
  • data (pandas.DataFrame) – dataframe with columns to search
  • threshold (int (optional)) – threshold for deleting columns
Returns:

low_variance_columns – a list of columns with low variance.
Return type:

list
features.build_features.find_low_var_categories(data, threshold=0.18)[source]¶

Finds categorical columns with low variance.

Takes a dataframe as input. Creates a list of columns with low threshold. These columns can then be dropped from original dataframe.

Parameters:
  • data (pandas.DataFrame) – dataframe with columns to search
  • threshold (int (optional)) – threshold for deleting columns
Returns:

low_variance_columns – a list of columns with low variance.
Return type:

list
features.build_features.replace_NaN(data)[source]¶

Replace NaN values with the median from numerical column.

Takes a dataframe as input. Iterates through the dataframe for numeric types columns. Replaces any NaN values with median value of column.

Parameters:data (pandas.DataFrame) – dataframe with columns to search
Returns:data – dataframe with columns containing replaced NaNs.
Return type:pandas.DataFrame
features.build_features.time_like(df)[source]¶

Finds time like columns.

Takes a dataframe as input. Iterates through the dataframe columns. Returns a list of potential time like columns.

Parameters:df (pandas.DataFrame) – dataframe with columns to search
Returns:low_variance_columns – a list of columns with low variance.
Return type:list
features.build_features.convert_to_timestamp(df, time_columns)[source]¶

Coverts columns in a dataframe to datetime.

Takes a dataframe and list of columns as input. Converts columns in list to datetime format, depending on the length of value. For values longer than 6, only the year is stripped.

Parameters:
  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – dataframe with columns to search
  • time_columns (list) – list of time like columns
Returns:

df – dataframe with converted time columns
Return type:

pandas.DataFrame
